speaker: CAMERON MCPECK
line: Almost home now, Jason. What do we say?

speaker: IRENE MCPECK AND JASON MCPECK
line: Sticks and stones may break my bones but words can never hurt me.

speaker: CAMERON MCPECK
line: Keep your chin up, son. We'll get through this just fine.

speaker: REPORTER
line: How do you feel, Jason?

speaker: DEPUTIES
line: Back up, now......Boys, come on! Everybody back. Clear the car. Get back. Alan, you're in charge!

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Okay, folks, come on out. You're safe now, don't worry. Just step out and stay in front of me. We'll get you in your house.

speaker: CAMERON MCPECK
line: Come on, son.

speaker: DEPUTY
line: Just stay in front of me.

speaker: IRENE MCPECK
line: There you go, sweetheart. If you need anything during the night... If you don't feel well you just ring that bell, okay?

speaker: JASON MCPECK
line: Okay, Mom.

speaker: IRENE MCPECK
line: Good night, Jason.

speaker: CAMERON MCPECK
line: I know you're afraid. Maybe you think those people outside are right-- that we should take you to the hospital and let the doctors treat you. We could do that... and they might take away your cancer... and your body might feel better... but not your soul. It's God himself who gave you this illness, Jason, for reasons that are His. If you're to be well in body and spirit it's God who must come to deliver you.

speaker: FADE TO
line: nan

speaker: MULDER
line: Good morning. Here's a story to warm the cockles of your heart, Scully. An 11-year-old boy, diagnosed with lymphatic cancer, cured with a miracle.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Jason McPeck, Goochland, Virginia.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. His parents refused treatment on religious grounds. His faith forbids medical aid and so Jason's cure was delivered by angels.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, spontaneous remission, Mulder, isn't completely unheard of. So-called miracle recoveries attributable to no clear cause or reason.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's not the miracle I'm suspicious of. It's the messenger. That came as an anonymous e-mail to me from the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency.

speaker: SCULLY
line: DARPA.

speaker: MULDER
line: Someone at DARPA. How'd you hear about it?

speaker: MULDER
line: You subscribe to the Goochland Guardian?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: MULDER
line: So this just appeared miraculously on your doorstep this morning?

speaker: SCULLY
line: As far as I can tell, I was the only one to whom it was delivered.

speaker: MULDER
line: Someone wants us on this case.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's not a case, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Not yet. I'm going to go back over to DARPA. You see what else you can find out about that boy.

speaker: MULDER
line: I've just got to know whether it was Roma Downey or Della Reese.

speaker: IRENE MCPECK
line: Yes?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hi, I'm Dana Scully with the, uh, Federal Bureau of Investigation. Are you Mrs. McPeck?

speaker: IRENE MCPECK
line: What can we do for you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm here about your son.

speaker: CAMERON MCPECK
line: Are we under investigation?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ah, no. I was just hoping to better understand what happened to him. May I ask is he okay?

speaker: IRENE MCPECK
line: Jason, we've got somebody to see you.

speaker: IRENE MCPECK
line: Tell her how you're feeling.

speaker: JASON MCPECK
line: I feel good. Just a little out of breath.

speaker: CAMERON MCPECK
line: You're looking at God's work. Jason's life owes to his Grace and exalts his name in the highest. Praise the Lord.

speaker: IRENE MCPECK
line: Praise the Lord.

speaker: JASON MCPECK
line: Praise the Lord.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And you say that you saw angels?

speaker: JASON MCPECK
line: Yes.

speaker: SCULLY
line: May I ask what they looked like?

speaker: JASON MCPECK
line: They looked like men. They came from the sky in a ball of light.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what did they say?

speaker: JASON MCPECK
line: They said not to be afraid. Then one of them pinched me kind of hard and then I was better right away.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He pinched you? Where?

speaker: JASON MCPECK
line: Right here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell are you doing?

speaker: CSM
line: God's work, what else?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Get out of my car!

speaker: CSM
line: I'd hoped for more accommodation toward the man that saved that young boy's life... and yours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got your light. Now get out.

speaker: CSM
line: You're not at all curious? About the chip that's been put in that boy's neck? You, a medical doctor who has the same technology in your body? Has witnessed this wondrous "miracle" first-hand? I've taken considerable trouble to prove my intentions. The newspaper at your door. The e-mail to Mulder.

speaker: CSM
line: The elaborate demonstration of curing this boy's cancer. You see, I'm dying myself.

speaker: CSM
line: A dying man who wants to make right; to share his secrets; to bequeath this cure to millions of others just like that boy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you want to give it to us.

speaker: CSM
line: To you, Agent Scully. I've tired of Mulder's mule-headedness-- his foolish ideas of overthrowing the system.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think I'm fooled by this?

speaker: CSM
line: I've made you my offer. Agent Mulder hears a breath of this rest assured, I'll rescind it... take it to my grave.

speaker: ALONE, SCULLY IS LOOKING AT THE CARD.  ONLY A PHONE NUMBER
line: 202-555-1030. She picks up the phone, dials, lets it ring twice, then hangs up quickly. She looks at the card again. She thinks. She picks up the phone and dials.)

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I need a trace on a D.C. area phone number. I need an address.

speaker: VOICE ON PHONE
line: Thank you.

speaker: GUARD
line: May I help you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, I, uh, made a mistake.

speaker: GUARD
line: May I see some identification?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, is this necessary? I just walked through the wrong door.

speaker: GUARD
line: Your identification, please.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look...

speaker: GUARD
line: Third floor.

speaker: CSM
line: Agent Scully... please, sit.

speaker: CSM
line: I'm glad you came.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You obviously knew that I would.

speaker: CSM
line: Well, I know you're a doctor and... a woman of compassion.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Please.

speaker: CSM
line: In the end... a man finally looks at the sum of his life to see what he'll leave behind. Most of what I worked to build is in ruins and now that the... darkness descends, I... find I have no real legacy.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you dying of?

speaker: CSM
line: Cerebral inflammation-- a consequence of brain surgery I had in the fall. The doctors give me just a few months.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, you want to use me to clear the slate... to make you a respectable person. It won't work.

speaker: CSM
line: How many people in the world are dying of cancer? And here we are wasting time with the past.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm here. Where is it... this miracle cure of yours?

speaker: CSM
line: We'll need to take a trip. It'll require a few days.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll get back to you.

speaker: CSM
line: I have access, Agent Scully. I have these miraculous chips but the genetic research that makes them work is closely guarded. There are men in this building who would kill me if they knew what I'd offered you. They'd kill you, too, in the blink of an eye. I've destroyed a lot of things in my life including the people most precious to me. All I want is a chance to do something in service to man before I go.

speaker: MACHINE VOICE
line: CALL RECEIVED 8:01 P.M..

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. I wanted to let you know that I'll be out of town for a day or two. It's a family emergency. I'll... I'll call you when I can.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This is Dana Scully. I'm not in right now. Please leave a message after the beep.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, Scully, it's me. Pick up if you're there. Scully? Are you there? All right, I just got, I got your message and I hope everything's okay. I'll try on your cell right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're going to smoke?

speaker: CSM
line: It's time I quit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Just like that.

speaker: CSM
line: No sacrifice is purely altruistic. We give expecting to receive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What exactly is it you expect to receive?

speaker: CSM
line: Your trust. You question my sincerity. You think I'm heartless. Would it soften your opinion of me if I confessed that I've always had a particular affection for you?

speaker: CSM
line: I assure you my intentions are honorable. I have affection for Mulder, too. My affection for you is special. I held your life in my hands. Your cancer was terminal. I had a cure. Can you imagine what that's like-- to have the power to extinguish a life or to save it and let it flourish? Now, to give you that power, so you can do the same.

speaker: LANDLORD
line: Yeah, she said it was a family matter. Dropped off the key... asked me to water the plants-- no biggie. Hey, great girl-- independent as they come, you know but a great girl.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, yeah.

speaker: LANDLORD
line: Tenants like having an FBI agent in the building. Gives them a sense of security.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you know how many people have died in there?

speaker: LANDLORD
line: Oh, we don't really talk about that.

speaker: MULDER
line: You said she was, uh, carrying a suitcase. Did you notice anything else, anything abnormal?

speaker: LANDLORD
line: No. No, actually it wasn't her carrying the suitcase. It was her driver.

speaker: MULDER
line: Her driver?

speaker: LANDLORD
line: Yeah, older guy... tall. I've seen him here before. Smokes like a chimney.

speaker: LANDLORD
line: Hey, don't you want...

speaker: CSM
line: You've been at the wheel too long. Would you like me to drive?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I might if you let me know where we're going.

speaker: CSM
line: Knowing that, you'd feel comfortable? You'd trust me?

speaker: CSM
line: How long did it take Mulder to win your trust?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've always trusted Mulder.

speaker: CSM
line: You're not being honest with yourself. Think back. There was a time when you feared for your future, for your career when you were first partnered with this man. I told you, I've studied you for years... and if you would permit me, I'd like to make an observation.

speaker: CSM
line: You're drawn to powerful men but you fear their power. You keep your guard up, a wall around your heart. How else do you explain that fearless devotion to a man obsessed, and, yet, a life alone? You'd die for Mulder but you won't allow yourself to love him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Wow. I'm learning a whole other side to you. You're not just a cold-blooded killer, you're a pop psychologist as well.

speaker: CSM
line: I've been a destroyer all my life. Before I die, I'd like to prove that I'm capable of something more.

speaker: CSM
line: Turn here, on the left.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are we going?

speaker: CSM
line: To show you what I'm capable of.

speaker: CSM
line: Her name's Marjorie Butters. She's got quite a green thumb. Plays a mean game of Scrabble if you're interested.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And what's her relationship to you?

speaker: CSM
line: Well, how should I put it? You could say that I'm her angel. Marjorie's 118 years old.

speaker: CSM
line: Marjorie!

speaker: MARJORIE BUTTERS
line: Hey!

speaker: MARJORIE BUTTERS
line: I'm glad to see you.

speaker: CSM
line: I thought I'd surprise you.

speaker: MARJORIE BUTTERS
line: I look an absolute wreck. I've been trying to get in some bulbs before spring.

speaker: CSM
line: Marjorie, uh, this is Dana Scully. She's a very good friend of mine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Nice to meet you.

speaker: MARJORIE BUTTERS
line: My pleasure. Well, come inside. I baked some fresh bread this morning and there are tomatoes in the garden.

speaker: CSM
line: To have this power... to visit this woman and see her joy... must be why you became a doctor.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll expect your call. Thanks.

speaker: SKINNER
line: She requisitioned a fleet sedan when she left the bureau yesterday. I don't know why and there have been no fuel charges.

speaker: MULDER
line: Her mother doesn't know anything about a family emergency.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Look, I know you're worried about the company that she's in but from what you've told me it's not like she's sneaking out. The truth is, she's gone to a lot of trouble to allay your fears.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know she can take care of herself. It's just not like her to lie to me.

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's my private line.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Skinner.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sir?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully, where are you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm on the road. Um, I'm sorry to call you on this line.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, it's all right. It's just we've been worried about you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Everything's okay. I just wanted you to express that to Mulder.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, he's standing right here. Why don't you do that yourself?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, sir. That's all right. Can you tell him that I'll call him later? Just, just tell him that I'm fine.

speaker: SKINNER
line: She says she's fine.

speaker: MULDER
line: She's in trouble.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm going to the restroom.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I'm trusting you'll be able to make sense of what's on this tape. I had no other way of contacting you. Please try to understand that I weighed the risks. I couldn't divulge these plans without risking them and I promise you that I weighed everything. Our current location is northbound on the upstate expressway. We are driving my FBI fleet sedan. I will promise I will get these tapes to you as fast as I can.

speaker: ATTENDANT
line: Whoa! Excuse me.

speaker: CSM
line: Lifesaver?

speaker: CSM
line: May as well get comfortable. We've got a good drive ahead.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's the masters of disguise.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Can we laugh it up in your apartment?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: We got heat on our tail.

speaker: BYERS
line: Did what you asked. We pulled up what we could on Scully.

speaker: LANGLY
line: We started with her credit cards to see if she purchased any airline tickets.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: And ended up hacking into some Defense Department node...

speaker: LANGLY
line: Where they demanded we immediately identify ourselves or face prosecution for espionage or crimes against the government.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, what does this have to do with finding Scully?

speaker: BYERS
line: When we went into her computer we found a series of deleted transmissions.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: E-mail that had been erased from her subdirectories but not her hard drive. A series of communications.

speaker: LANGLY
line: From someone named Cobra.

speaker: MULDER
line: Who the hell is Cobra? Scully would have told me about him.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Well, it looks like she's gone to great lengths to keep this from you.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't believe that. She knows that I'd find her, no matter what.

speaker: BYERS
line: Mulder, we can't find her. There's nowhere to start looking.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't believe that, either. Give me that.

speaker: CSM
line: How do you take your coffee?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Unadulterated, thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You drugged me.

speaker: CSM
line: I did nothing of the sort.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How the hell did I get out of my clothes and into bed?

speaker: CSM
line: I carried you. You'd been up for over 30 hours. You were delirious. I only wanted to make you comfortable.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where are we?

speaker: CSM
line: Milford, Pennsylvania.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, that wasn't part of the deal. I don't know what you're up to.

speaker: CSM
line: Keys are in the ignition. You're free to go, of course. The choice is still yours.

speaker: MULDER
line: Sir, I need your attention.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is my assistant...?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. She's away from her desk. I wouldn't just bust in here but, as I said, it's a breaking situation.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What the hell's going on here?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's my question exactly. I believe you've all met.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Is this place secure?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is it secure?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Don't get testy, G-man.

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you aware of a federal fugitive, code name Cobra? For the past six months Cobra's been e-mailing Scully from the Department of Defense where he works on a shadow project for advanced research.

speaker: BYERS
line: A shadow project is right.

speaker: LANGLY
line: Where this dude works even the shadows have shadows.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Is that what I'm looking at here?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. What they're pulling up is Scully's correspondence back to Cobra.

speaker: SKINNER
line: She has a relationship?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Somebody posing as Scully who hacked into her computer and has been capturing all her e-mail. Passing themselves off as Scully in order to win Cobra's trust. The last five exchanges hint at a meeting where they're going to exchange information on the project Cobra's working on.

speaker: SKINNER
line: A meeting where?

speaker: FROHIKE
line: Don't know. They just ended.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Who's been in her computer?

speaker: MULDER
line: Smoking man. Or someone working for him. You got to get to him now.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You of all people should know that you just don't get to him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, if you don't get to him it may be the last time we see Scully alive.

speaker: CSM
line: We'll be getting final instructions from our contact tonight. He's invited us to dinner. I took the liberty of getting you something to wear.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It's, uh... It's beautiful.

speaker: CSM
line: I'm glad you like it. I look forward to tonight.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, your contact's going to join us?

speaker: CSM
line: I presume so.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You extol our great trust but you still haven't told me who he is.

speaker: CSM
line: He is to human genetic science as Oppenheimer and Fermi were to the advent of nuclear warfare.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm still not clear what my importance is to this exchange.

speaker: CSM
line: This man-- call him Cobra-- he needs assurances that the science he's going to hand over won't fall into the wrong hands. I've told him of you.

speaker: CSM
line: He's expecting to meet you here. Well, to the future.

speaker: CSM
line: I must tell you something else. Something that's so unbelievable, so incredible... that to know it is to look at the entire world anew.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: CSM
line: What we are being given... it's not the cure for cancer. It's the holiest of grails, Dana. It's the cure for all human disease.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How?

speaker: CSM
line: It's from that final frontier. It's largely extraterrestrial.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then you would be cured.

speaker: CSM
line: That which makes miracles can also make

speaker: GREAT EVIL.  THERE ARE THOSE WHO WOULD USE THIS POWER FOR THEIR OWN PURPOSES
line: To choose who will live and who will die. Theoretically, I can be cured. Everything I've told you about wanting to make right? I'm a lonely man, Dana.

speaker: CSM
line: Would you excuse me?

speaker: CSM
line: Cobra hasn't shown.

speaker: BLACK-HAIRED MAN
line: What do you want to do?

speaker: CSM
line: Wait. What else can we do?

speaker: BLACK-HAIRED MAN
line: What trust you've won... Scully won't stick around forever. What's wrong?

speaker: CSM
line: Just do your damn job.

speaker: CSM
line: Calico Inlet's 15 minutes out. South end.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do I do when I get there?

speaker: CSM
line: I don't know. Just wait. Be careful.

speaker: SCIENTIST/COBRA
line: Finally we meet. You're just as you described yourself. Certainly more so last night at dinner.

speaker: SCIENTIST/COBRA
line: I only wish we could continue to correspond but it must end after this. I hope one day we can take some time when I'm not a marked man. This is it. The science I promised you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, wait. Where did you get this? Where did it come from, this science?

speaker: SCIENTIST/COBRA
line: Where did it come from?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who developed it?

speaker: SCIENTIST/COBRA
line: Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I'm Scully but I don't believe that we've spoken before or corresponded.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They shot him. They killed him and they shot at me.

speaker: CSM
line: Did you get it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You told me that no one else knew about this.

speaker: CSM
line: I wouldn't have sent you if I thought there'd be any danger.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, man.

speaker: CSM
line: Dana...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I got it.

speaker: CSM
line: Forgive me. Here... take it. This is for you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I've got to go.

speaker: CSM
line: Go.

speaker: FROHIKE
line: There's nothing on this.

speaker: LANGLY
line: It's empty.

speaker: BYERS
line: Completely.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No, it can't be. It can't be. It's got to be on there.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was here! These were his offices. What the hell is this?

speaker: MULDER
line: He used you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, he laid it all out for me. I recorded it. I mailed you the tape.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This old woman, Marjorie Butters, I met her. I saw her pictures, her birth certificate...

speaker: MULDER
line: You saw what you needed to see in order to make you believe.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, then what about this boy? This boy with cancer? You can't deny that. That's undeniable proof.

speaker: MULDER
line: Even if we could convince his parents to let us march him out how long before that chip in his neck mysteriously disappears? This was the perfectly executed con, Scully. The only thing I can't figure out is why you're still alive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I looked into his eyes. I swear what he told me was true.

speaker: MULDER
line: He did it all for himself-- to get the science on that disk. His sincerity was a mask, Scully. The man's motives never changed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think he used me to save himself-- at the expense of the human race.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, he knows what that science is worth, how powerful it is. He'd let nothing stand in his way.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You may be right... but for a moment, I saw something else in him. A longing for something more than power. Maybe for something he could never have.
